content:
ergehring said
What would cause an unexpected error when trying to export a profile?

Very often an antivirus product. It will also be slowing the export, often by a lot while is fiddles and muddles re-scanning everything that is accessed to copy it.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thank you for your response. I have disabled the anti virus software. The export reaches about 45% before encountering the error.
creator: ergehring

content:
Duane Doberman said
Can anyone suggest how we stop the auto-creation of these subfolders? Many thanks in anticipation!

The files are created when the file is unavailable due to file contention, Thunderbird just goes off and creates a new file and gives it a number in that circumstance. Folk that more the location data is stored from the default %appdata% folder are those most likely to have issues as they tend to place exceedingly large file into the general documents storage so their antivirus spends half it's time rescanning the same 4 or 5gb file each time a single email is added to it or marked read.

Most likely cause is your antivirus scanning the folder the emails are stored in prevent that and see how you go.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Se sei certo di aver configurato Thunderbird con i giusti parametri, allora devi contattare il fornitore/gestore della casella email. È un errore lato server, non dipende da Thunderbird.
creator: @next

content: Buongiorno, ho fatto tutte le prove, spegni e riaccendi, termina operazione, ho aggiornato ma nulla.. Il messaggio è questo: Thunderbird è già avviato ma non risponde. Il processo esistente di Thunderbird deve essere chiuso per aprire una nuova finestra.
creator: o.pulvirenti

content: First, I suggest you verify that you can read email from your online account. That would ensure that you have a working password.
creator: davidsk

content:
It may look like a duplicate account (but is not) because you seem to have re-named the local folders account, which cannot be deleted.

So do you have a server account and a local folders account with the same name?

In your place, I would change the name back to "Local folders".
creator: mozilla98

content: Suggestion: If you have two accounts in thunderbird with same domain, my guess is you have accidentally set both accounts to use the same SMTP server. For the one that is not working, try this; - click to 'account settings' for that account and highlight account name in left side bar - now, in lower right, click the 'edit SMTP server' button. note the email address for the SMTP server. does it match the email address for the account? If not, click back and click the drop-down menu and select the other SMTP server. -
creator: davidsk
